title: :wrench: add missing features
body: When publishing, several drivers failed to build because the were inheriting features from the workspace. This commit adds features to the drivers' `Cargo.toml` files so they can build on their own.

title: Drop backend crates
body: When I started this project, I was new to Rust. I don't know why I thought the back-ends needed to be crates; no one is ever going to use them as a dependency. This pull-request moves the contents into the `drmemd` source tree and removes the crates.

title: Resolve #88

title: Improve some code
body:
Added several improvements:

- In the logic block evaluator, the solar and time variables now restrict the second level field instead of using `&str`.
- Updated the dependencies.
- Remove compiler warnings from test code.

body: This pull request closes #113.

title: prep for v0.4.0
body:
Miscellaneous commits to prep for v0.4.0:

- Bump version number on all crates
- Pull in latest crates
  - Fix any API changes
  - Run all tests

*NOTE: This is not the v0.4.0 release! This is to make sure things compile. There are still a few features to be added to the release.*

title: :sparkles: add "initial" cfg param to memory driver
body:
This commit adds the "initial" parameter to the driver configuration for the memory driver. Users can have the memory device take on a default value when the driver starts up.

This feature was added because the DrMem browser couldn't display a device's value or know what setting type to use until the device reported at least one value.

title: Pr issue107
body: Adds an alpha channel to the `Color` type.

title: Pull request with miscellaneous changes
body:
This pull request contains a few miscellaneous changes:

- Some clean-up in the logic block grammar.
- Optimized time-of-day wake-ups for logic blocks.

body: This pull request adds `Color` to the `device::Value` enumeration. Devices can now use color!

title: Optimization
body: Saw a YouTube video stating that copying and moving `Arc<str>` types is better than `String`, when the strings don't need to be modified.

title: Miscellaneous changes
body: These are some small details that I wanted to add. They don't fix bugs but, rather, improve how DrMem behaves. So these don't have corresponding GitHub issues.

title: Fix regression in TP-Link driver
body: Fixes a bug introduced in 5f033095491b38d20427e04f283b8ad1cd280f29. I was trying to create a dynamically-sized buffer without resorting to `unsafe` code. But it didn't work. This pull request includes a test that will detect if the code breaks (if I try to improve it in the future.)

title: Add time-of-day driver
body: This pull request adds a time-of-day driver to DrMem. This is an internal driver for `drmemd` so it's always available.

title: :bug: add `sync` feature to `Cargo.toml`
body: This crate would probably not build on its own without this feature.

title: :bug: fix dependencies
body: The TP-Link driver would compile fine when building `drmemd`. However, when trying to publish it to crates.io, it would fail. This commit enables the features that the driver requires.

title: :bug: handle broken TCP connections
body: This commit propagates netwok errors to the main loop and will cause the driver to create a new socket. This will handle all errors; getting out of sync, broken socket connections, etc.

title: Miscellaneous changes
body: While working on an issue, several minor, unrelated changes were made. Rather than pollute the other pull request, I thought I'd roll them into this misc. pull request.

title: :bug: driver wasn't detecting a stale TCP connection
body:
This driver was using `tokio::net::TcpStream` to connect to the RPi that was monitoring the sump pump. If that connection broke (due to a power outage, for instance), the driver would wait forever and would never get any data from the remote end.

This commit pulls in the `socket2` crate so that we can turn on the "keep-alive" option for the socket (`tokio` doesn't provide this option.)

Note that we use the `socket2` crate's API to build, configure, and connect the socket before converting it to a `tokio` socket. The `socket2` API is synchronous so, for connecting, I set the timeout to 0.1 seconds. This is more than enough time to connect and it minimizes the amount of time taken away from other async tasks.

title: Pr issue13
body:
At the moment, I'm working on phase 1 of the issue which adds some type-safety to the driver's API. Drivers need to report values and receive values (for settable devices.) This requires changes in 3 types:

- The `ReportReading` closure now takes a type parameter. When registering a device, its type is also declared. No longer can one accidentally save a `String` for a `bool` device.
- When registering, the previous value (if any) of the device is returned. This value needs to be converted to the device's type (instead of just being a `device::Value`.
- Incoming settings need to convert `device::Value` types to the device's declared type. If it can't, the API should automatically send a `TypeError` back to the client.

At this point, I've pushed commits which support the first two requirements. I'm still working on the third.

This pull request will close out #13.

title: Clean up some code
body: While looking at the driver code, I didn't like that defining the device names could return an error. These are constant values and, once correctly defined, will never change. So the main portion of this pull request is to move those definitions outside the future that is returned.

title: :sparkles: add `max_history` option to config
body:
The TOML config file now supports an optional `max_history`, integer field for each driver instance. This parameter is a hint to the backend storage as to how many data point should be stored for the device.

This commit resolves issue #24.

title: Remove gRPC support
body: The GraphQL interface is working well and there are other, more important, things that need to be finished before added a second client interface. For now, the minimal gRPC support that existed is removed.

title: Fixing Redis
body: This pull request, when ready, will fix the redis backend so it supports the full GraphQL API.

title: Expanding character set for device names
body:
This pull request expands the characters we can use in device names. I added a couple of tests but they're not exhaustive. I wanted to test characters from cultures that don't use latin letters. So I used a Japanese example, which worked. I then tried using a Thai example but I couldn't get it to work. I'm not a Unicode expert so I don't know why Rust's `char::is_alphanumeric` function rejected some of the characters. If this project gets popular and some non-english speaking people find deficiencies, we can open another issue and do a more thorough job.

This resolves #12.

title: Issue 18
body:
This pull request resolves #18.

I tested the timeouts by pulling the network cable for the remote Pi out of the switch. After ~20 seconds, `drmemd` reported it couldn't communicate with it. I put the cable back in its spigot and `drmemd` started reporting the status.

title: :bug: resolves issue #5
body: The `millis` parameter for the cycle driver now represents the entire cycle time, as the docs indicate. The fastest cycling frequency has been set to 10 hz because DrMem is a 20 Hz control system and 10 hz will give us 20 changes per second.
